channel.title: Converting a string into a hashmap, tell me if im right?
channel.description:
Converting a string into a hashmap can be done this way: String st = "1=a, 2=b, 3=c, 4=d";
Please tell me if i'm wrong and made an error, havnt tried this in years.
i think the code was [code]public static Map<String,String> parseMap(String text) { Map<String,String> map = new LinkedHashMap<String,String>(); for(String keyValue: text.split(", ")) { String[] parts = keyValue.split("=", 2); map.put(parts[0], parts[1]); } return map;}[/code]
sorry for the lack of conventions
_Ikram

item.title: Converting a string into a hashmap, tell me if im right?
item.dc:creator: @unlimitedorb unlimitedorb
item.description:
@unlimitedorb wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:6, topic:282162”][quote author=unlimitedorb link=topic=372825.msg2815190#msg2815190 date=1244240917]

_ikram:

Converting a string into a hashmap, tell me if im right?

i stopped there, and your already wrong.

Don’t be a fool. Parsing a string into a HashMap is a perfectly reasonable operation.
[/quote]

oh sorry, i didn’t know converting meant parsing, read before you comment.[/quote]

They mean the same thing in this context you would-be hypocritical dumbass. Maybe if YOU read that far, you’d understand that… it wouldn’t matter anyway since reading comprehension doesn’t seem to be your thing.

Read full topic

item.title: Converting a string into a hashmap, tell me if im right?
item.dc:creator: @Zero_Freeze ZeroFreeze
item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

OP:
yes, it should work. Protip: Don’t cramp code into one line and try compiling it yourself next time.

_ikram:

Lol. Ok, forget it i’m sure you all know the basics of hashmaps, i’ll post a more advanced tutorial in a while once i finish writing it.

I fail to see the resemblance to the original topic.
P.S: Nobody needs your “advanced tutorial about hashmaps”.

Edit: actually Jorsa just explained how useful this is!! I’m not really sure where it goes though. could you tell me which line I have to put it under in runserver.bat?

_ikram:

Lol. Ok, forget it i’m sure you all know the basics of hashmaps, i’ll post a more advanced tutorial in a while once i finish writing it.

thanks man, i will be looking forward to it.

Read full topic

item.title: Converting a string into a hashmap, tell me if im right?
item.dc:creator: @_ikram _ikram
item.description:
@_ikram wrote:

Converting a string into a hashmap can be done this way:
String st = “1=a, 2=b, 3=c, 4=d”;

Please tell me if i’m wrong and made an error, havnt tried this in years.

i think the code was

public static Map<String,String> parseMap(String text) {    Map<String,String> map = new LinkedHashMap<String,String>();    for(String keyValue: text.split(", ")) {        String[] parts = keyValue.split("=", 2);        map.put(parts[0], parts[1]);    }    return map;}

sorry for the lack of conventions

_Ikram
